newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Standard acquires Warrior International.
newsitem.headline: Standard acquires Warrior International.

text.p: Standard Bank London, part of Standard Bank Investment Corp Ltd, said on Monday it had acquired Warrior International, a London-based specialist mining corporate finance company.
No financial details of the transaction were given.

Warrior, with offices in London, Chicago and Wellington, provides corporate finance advisory services to international mining companies, particularly regarding private treaty cross-border transactions.

Standard Bank London executive vice-chairman Pieter Prinsloo said the deal extends the South African group's resource banking capabilities, adding 11 professionals to the existing complement of 40 located in Johannesburg, London, New York and Hong Kong.
"The acquisition is an important step in Standard Bank's strategic aim to build an international resource banking business," Prinsloo said.
"A major focus of this effort is on mining and metals and Warrior provides us with a significant presence in that market."
